intro: Layia septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern blanketflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous small, tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. Layia septentrionalis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with well-drained soils.
